title: Emotional Intelligence
description: Learn to understand and manage emotions in yourself and others.

activities.title: Understanding Emotions
activities.content: Emotions are like signals that tell us how we're feeling inside. Everyone has emotions! Learning to name them is the first step to understanding them.
activities.instructions: Look at the emotion faces and try to identify what each one is feeling.

activities.title: Emotion Matching Game
activities.content: Match the emotion with the correct face and situation.
activities.instructions: Drag the emotion word to the matching face.

questions.question: What emotion might you feel when you lose your favorite toy?

options.text: When you get a birthday present

questions.question: What can you do when you feel angry?

options.text: Take deep breaths and count to 10

activities.title: Coping with Strong Emotions
activities.content: Sometimes we feel emotions very strongly. It's okay to feel all emotions, but we need healthy ways to express them.
activities.instructions: Learn different strategies for managing strong emotions.

activities.title: Create Your Calm-Down Plan
activities.content: Make a personal plan for what to do when strong emotions come up.
activities.instructions: Choose three strategies you can use when you feel upset or overwhelmed.

title: Financial Literacy
description: Learn the basics of money management, saving, and smart spending.

activities.title: What is Money?
activities.content: Money is what we use to buy things we need and want. People earn money by working at jobs.
activities.instructions: Look at the different types of currency and learn what they're worth.

activities.title: Needs vs. Wants
activities.content: Learning to tell the difference between things we need and things we want helps us make smart choices with money.
activities.instructions: Sort the items into 'needs' and 'wants' categories.

activities.title: Saving Money
activities.content: Saving means keeping some money for later instead of spending it all now. This helps you buy bigger things in the future.
activities.instructions: Learn why saving is important and how to set savings goals.

activities.title: Money Math Challenge
activities.content: Practice basic money skills by solving simple math problems with dollars and cents.
activities.instructions: Solve the money math problems to help the characters make good choices.

options.text: A plan for how to use your money

questions.question: Why is it good to save money?

options.text: So you can buy everything you want right now
So you never have to spend money
So you can buy bigger things later or have money for emergencies

questions.question: If you have $5 and you buy a toy that costs $3, how much money do you have left?

title: Communication Skills
description: Learn how to express yourself clearly and listen to others effectively.

activities.title: What is Communication?
activities.content: Communication is how we share our thoughts, feelings, and ideas with other people. We can communicate with words, our faces, and our bodies.
activities.instructions: Explore different types of communication and why they're important.

activities.title: Active Listening Practice
activities.content: Active listening means really paying attention to what someone is saying, not just waiting for your turn to talk.
activities.instructions: Listen to the stories and answer questions about what you heard.

activities.title: Using 'I' Statements
activities.content: 'I' statements help us talk about our feelings without blaming others. Instead of saying 'You made me mad,' we can say 'I feel mad when...'
activities.instructions: Learn how to turn blame statements into 'I' statements.

activities.title: Body Language Detective
activities.content: Our faces and bodies can 'talk' even when we don't say words. This is called body language.
activities.instructions: Look at the pictures and try to figure out what the person might be feeling.

options.text: Listening to music while doing homework
Paying close attention and showing interest in what someone is saying
Waiting for your turn to talk

questions.question: Which is an example of an 'I' statement?

options.text: I feel frustrated when I'm interrupted.
It can show how we're feeling even without words
It's only important when talking to teachers

title: First Aid & Safety
description: Learn basic first aid skills and how to stay safe in different situations.

activities.title: Safety Basics
activities.content: Staying safe means knowing how to prevent accidents and what to do if someone gets hurt.
activities.instructions: Learn about basic safety rules at home, school, and outdoors.

activities.title: Emergency Contacts
activities.content: It's important to know who to call in an emergency.
activities.instructions: Learn about emergency numbers and create a list of important contacts.

activities.title: Basic First Aid
activities.content: First aid is the help we give to someone who is hurt or sick before a doctor can help them.
activities.instructions: Learn about simple first aid techniques for minor injuries.

activities.title: Safety Scenarios
activities.content: What would you do in these different safety situations?
activities.instructions: Choose the best action to take in each safety scenario.

questions.question: What number should you call in an emergency in the United States?
What should you do for a small cut?

options.text: Clean it with water and soap, then cover with a bandage

questions.question: What should you do if you see a fire?

options.text: Try to put it out yourself
Get out of the building and call for help

title: Environmental Awareness
description: Learn about nature, environmental protection, and sustainable practices.

activities.title: Our Planet Earth
activities.content: Earth is our home and has important natural resources like water, air, plants, and animals that we need to protect.
activities.instructions: Learn about the different environments on Earth and why they're important.

activities.title: Recycling Challenge
activities.content: Recycling means turning used items into new things instead of throwing them away as trash.
activities.instructions: Sort the items into the correct recycling categories.

activities.title: Water Conservation
activities.content: Water is precious, and we need to use it carefully so everyone has enough.
activities.instructions: Learn how to save water at home and school.

activities.title: Eco-Detective
activities.content: Find ways to be more environmentally friendly in everyday situations.
activities.instructions: Identify the eco-friendly choices in each scenario.

options.text: It helps reduce waste and saves resources
It makes our trash cans look colorful
Turning off the faucet while brushing your teeth
Leaving the hose running all day

questions.question: What can you do to help birds and insects in your neighborhood?

options.text: Plant flowers that provide food for them

title: Physical Activities
description: Learn about staying active, healthy movement, and fun exercises.

activities.title: Why Movement Matters
activities.content: Moving our bodies helps us stay healthy, feel good, and have more energy for the things we love to do.
activities.instructions: Learn about the benefits of physical activity and how it helps your body and mind.

activities.title: Fun Fitness Activities
activities.content: Exercise doesn't have to be boring! There are many fun ways to stay active.
activities.instructions: Explore different types of physical activities and find ones you might enjoy.

activities.title: Stretching Basics
activities.content: Stretching helps our muscles stay flexible and prevents injuries.
activities.instructions: Learn simple stretches you can do before and after activities.

activities.title: Create a Movement Plan
activities.content: Planning your physical activities can help you make sure you get enough movement each day.
activities.instructions: Build a weekly schedule with different types of physical activities.

questions.question: How much physical activity should kids get each day?

options.text: It helps prevent injuries and keeps muscles flexible
